intro: Borreria incognita, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, helping to reduce water loss. Borreria incognita is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
